thread.title_full: An all day cinema screening 1980s movies is opening in Manchester - Manchester Evening News

author: Sarah Walters
title: An all day cinema screening 1980s movies is opening in Manchester - Manchester Evening News
text:
An all day cinema screening 1980s movies is opening in Manchester Expect a varied calendar of classics - from The Princess Bride to Lethal Weapon Share Get What's On updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A pop-up cinema celebrating a vintage year in movies is opening in Manchester. 
The Class of 1987 All-Dayer will screen some of the biggest blockbusters of the year, including Mel Gibson classic Lethal Weapon, teen coming of age adventure The Lost Boys, cult fairytale The Princess Bride, and He-Man adaptation Masters Of The Universe, starring Dolph Lundgren and Courteney Cox. 
The RAD cinema is the idea of Grimm Up North festival's Matt Chambers, who says it's about time we paid tribute to these legendary flicks 30 years after their release. Read More A pop up cinema is coming to a listed Manchester mill The Lost Boys (Photo: Channel 5 Broadcasting) 
The cinema will open at live venue Gorilla, on Whitworth Street West, on April 9 for a movie marathon that lasts for more than 12 hours. 
The cinema opens at midday, and tickets are £10 for the full programme or £4 for an individual film. Like us on Facebook
